Admin:AAA:Authentication:AuthenticationD.description:
Authentication Default Settings.  
  * console
  * default
  * icmp_reachability
  * remote_user_login_policy

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

login_domain.description: Name of the Login Domain to assign to console authentication.
login_domain.title: login_domain

realm.description:
The security method for processing authentication and authorization requests. The realm allows the protected resources on the associated server to be partitioned into a set of protection spaces, each with its own authentication authorization database. This is an abstract class and cannot be instantiated.   Options are:
  * duo_proxy_ldap
  * duo_proxy_radius
  * ldap
  * local: (default)
  * radius
  * rsa
  * saml
  * tacacs
realm.title: realm

console_authentication.title: console_authentication - Admin => AAA => Authentication: Authentication Default Settings: Console Authentication.

annotation.title: annotation

fallback_check.description: Flag to allow fallback to local authentication in the event the Login Domain is unavailable.
fallback_check.title: fallback_check

login_domain.description: Name of the Login Domain to assign to default authentication.
login_domain.title: login_domain

realm.description:
The security method for processing authentication and authorization requests. annotation.title: annotation

ping_check.description: Heart beat ping checks for RADIUS/TACACS/LDAP/SAML/RSA server reachability.

remote_user_login_policy.description:
The default role policy of remote user. Allowed values are:
  * assign-default-role
  * no-login: (default)
remote_user_login_policy.title: remote_user_login_policy

retries.description: The number of attempts that the authentication method is tried. Allowed range: '0-5'.  Default is 1.
retries.title: retries

timeout.description: The amount of time between authentication attempts. Allowed range: '1-60'.  Default is 5.
timeout.title: timeout

remote_authentication.title: remote_authentication - Admin => AAA => Authentication: Authentication Default Settings: Remote Authentication.

Admin:AAA:Authentication:AuthenticationD.title: authentication_default_settings - Admin => AAA => Authentication: Authentication Default Settings

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

authorization_protocol.description:
The RADIUS authentication protocol. The protocol can be:
  * chap
  * mschap
  * pap: (default)
authorization_protocol.title: authorization_protocol

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

hosts.description: List of RADIUS Providers to add to the Login Domain.  The Priority will be assigned based on the order of the providers added.
hosts.title: hosts

login_domain.description: A Name for the Login Domain to Assign these RADIUS Providers to.
login_domain.title: login_domain

management_epg.description: The name of the Management EPG to assign to the hosts.  Default is 'default'.
management_epg.title: management_epg

port.description: The UDP port number to be used when making connections to the RADIUS daemon. The range is from 1 to 65535.  Default is 1812.
port.title: port

retries.description: The number of retries when contacting the TACACS+ endpoint. The range is from 0 to 5 retries. The default is 1.
retries.title: retries

server_monitoring.description:
server_monitoring - Attributes are:
  * admin_state
  * username
Enabling Server Monitoring allows the connectivity of the remote AAA servers to be tested.

username.description: The username to assign to the server monitoring configuration.
username.title: username

server_monitoring.title: server_monitoring

timeout.description: The period of time (in seconds) the device will wait for a response from the daemon before it times out and declares an error. The range is from 1 to 60 seconds. The default is 5 seconds. If set to 0, the AAA provider timeout is used.
timeout.title: timeout

type.description:
Type of object RADIUS Provider. Allowed values are:
  * duo
  * radius
type.title: type

Admin:AAA:Authentication:Radius.title: radius - Admin => AAA => Login Domains/Providers type RADIUS.

authorization_protocol.description:
The TACACS+ authentication protocol. The protocol can be:
  * chap
  * mschap
  * pap: (default)
authorization_protocol.title: authorization_protocol

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

hosts.description: List of TACACS+ Providers to add to the Login Domain.  The Priority will be assigned based on the order of the providers added.
hosts.title: hosts

login_domain.description: A Name for the Login Domain to Assign these TACACS+ Providers to.
login_domain.title: login_domain

management_epg.description: The name of the Management EPG to assign to the hosts.  Default is 'default'.
management_epg.title: management_epg

port.description: The TCP port number to be used when making connections to the TACACS+ daemon. The range is from 1 to 65535. The default is 49.
port.title: port

retries.description: The number of retries when contacting the TACACS+ endpoint. The range is from 0 to 5 retries. The default is 1.
retries.title: retries

server_monitoring.description:
server_monitoring - Attributes are:
  * admin_state
  * username
Enabling Server Monitoring allows the connectivity of the remote AAA servers to be tested.

username.description: The username to assign to the server monitoring configuration.
username.title: username

server_monitoring.title: server_monitoring

timeout.description: The period of time (in seconds) the device will wait for a response from the daemon before it times out and declares an error. The range is from 1 to 60 seconds. The default is 5 seconds. If set to 0, the AAA provider timeout is used.
timeout.title: timeout

type.description:
COOP protocol is enhanced to support two ZMQ authentication modes:
  * compatible — Type COOP accepts both MD5 authenticated and non-authenticated ZMQ connections for message transportation.
  * strict: (defualt) — COOP allows MD5 authenticated ZMQ connections only.
Note: The APIC provides a managed object (fabric:SecurityToken), that includes an attribute to be used for the MD5 password. An attribute in this managed object, called 'token', is a string that changes every hour. COOP obtains the notification from the DME to update the password for ZMQ authentication. The attribute token value is not displayed.
type.title: type

Admin:AAA:Authentication:Tacacs.title: tacacs - Admin => AAA => Login Domains/Providers type TACACS.

lockout_user.description:
lockout_user - Attributes are:
  * enable_lockout
  * lockout_duration
  * max_failed_attempts
  * max_failed_attempts_window
List of Lockout User Attributes.

enable_lockout.description:
Enable blocking of user logins after failed attempts. Allowed values are:
  * disable: (default)
  * enable
enable_lockout.title: enable_lockout

lockout_duration.description: Duration in minutes for which login should be blocked.Duration in minutes for which future logins should be blocked Allowed range is 1-1440.  Default is 60.
lockout_duration.title: lockout_duration

max_failed_attempts.description: Maximum continuous failed logins before blocking user.max failed login attempts before blocking user login Allowed range is 1-15.  Default is 5.
max_failed_attempts.title: max_failed_attempts

max_failed_attempts_window.description: Time period for maximum continuous failed logins.times in minutes for max login failures to occur before blocking the user Allowed range is 1-720.  Default is 5.
max_failed_attempts_window.title: max_failed_attempts_window

lockout_user.title: lockout_user

maximum_validity_period.description: Maximum Validity Period in hours.The maximum validity period for a web token. Allowed range is 4-24.  Default is 24.
maximum_validity_period.title: maximum_validity_period

no_change_interval.description: No Password Change Interval in Hours.A minimum period after a password change before the user can change the password again. Allowed range is 0-745.  Default is 24.
no_change_interval.title: no_change_interval

password_change_interval.description: A time interval for limiting the number of password changes. Allowed range is 0-745. The default is 48.
password_change_interval.title: password_change_interval

password_change_interval_enforce.description:
The change count/change interval policy selector. This property enables you to select an option for enforcing password change. Allowed values are:
  * disable
  * enable: (default)
password_change_interval_enforce.title: password_change_interval_enforce

password_changes_within_interval.description: Number of Password Changes in Interval.  The number of password changes allowed within the change interval. Allowed range is 0-10. The default is 2.
password_changes_within_interval.title: password_changes_within_interval

password_expiration_warn_time.description: Password Expiration Warn Time in Days.  A warning period before password expiration. A warning will be displayed when a user logs in within this number of days of an impending password expiration. Allowed range is 0-30. The default is 15.
password_expiration_warn_time.title: password_expiration_warn_time

password_strength_check.description: Password Strength Check.  The password strength check specifies if the system enforces the strength of the user password.
password_strength_check.title: password_strength_check

user_passwords_to_store_count.description: Password History Count.  How many retired passwords are stored in a user's password history. Allowed range is 0-15. The default is 5.
user_passwords_to_store_count.title: user_passwords_to_store_count

web_session_idle_timeout.description: GUI Idle Timeout in Seconds.  The maximum interval time the GUI remains idle before login needs to be refreshed. Allowed range is 60-65525. The default is 1200.
web_session_idle_timeout.title: web_session_idle_timeout

web_token_timeout.description: Timeout in Seconds.  The web token timeout interval. Allowed range is 300-9600. The default is 600.
web_token_timeout.title: web_token_timeout

admin_state.description:
The admin state of the Smart Callhome destination group profile. The state can be:
  * disabled
  * enabled: (default)
admin_state.title: admin_state

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

contact_information.description: The customer contact Identifier. Note that the customer ID associated with the Smart Callhome configuration in Cisco UCS must be the CCO (Cisco.com) account name associated with a support contract that includes Smart Callhome.  If undefined it will use customer_contact_email.
contact_information.title: contact_information

contract_id.description: The contract information provided by the customer.
contract_id.title: contract_id

customer_contact_email.description: The email address of the contact for the system or site. This address is not necessarily the same as the reply-to addresses used in the outgoing emails.
customer_contact_email.title: customer_contact_email

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

from_email.description: The email address of the sender.  If undefined it will use customer_contact_email.
from_email.title: from_email

name.description: A Name for the Smart Callhome Policy.  Recommend 'default'
name.title: name

reply_to_email.description: The reply-to email address for emails sent.  If undefined it will use customer_contact_email.
reply_to_email.title: reply_to_email

smart_destinations.description:
smart_destinations - List of email addresses to send smart callHome information.  Required Attributes:
  * email

Optional Attributes:
  * admin_state
  * format
  * rfc_compliant

admin_state.description:
Enables and disables the IP aging policy, options are:
  * disabled
  * enabled: (default)
admin_state.title: admin_state

email.description: The email address of the destination/receiver.
email.title: email

rfc_compliant.description: Flag to send messages only to be sent in RFC-compliant formats.
rfc_compliant.title: rfc_compliant

smart_destinations.title: smart_destinations

site_id.description: The site ID provided by the customer. This is the ID of the network where the site is deployed.
site_id.title: site_id

smtp_server.description:
The SMTP Server to Use for sending Smart Callhome messages.  Required Attributes are:
  * management_epg
  * name

Optional Attributes are:
  * port_number
  username

host.description: The hostname or IP for the Smart Callhome destination group profile. Smart Callhome sends email messages to either the IP address or hostname and the associated port number.
host.title: host

management_epg.description: The name of the Management EPG to assign to the server.  Default is 'default'.
management_epg.title: management_epg

port_number.description: The SMTP server port number for the Smart Callhome destination group profile. Note that you must configure the SMTP server address for the Smart Callhome functionality to work. You can also configure the from and reply-to e-mail addresses. The port rage is from 0 to 65535.  Default is 25.
port_number.title: port_number

username.description: Username for the smtp server when secure_smtp is enabled.
username.title: username

smtp_server.title: smtp_server

street_address.description: The Street Address of the customer.
street_address.title: street_address

remote_destinations - List of email addresses to send smart callHome information.  Required Attributes:
  * email

Optional Attributes:

  * format

The administrative state of the remote destination host. The values can be:
  * disabled
  * enabled: (default)
admin_state.title: admin_state

The facility to be used to send messages to this destination.  Options are:
  * local0
  * local1
  * local2
  * local3
  * local4
  * local5
  * local6
  * local7: (default)
forwarding_facility.title: forwarding_facility

items.description: The hostname or IP address for export destination.

management_epg.title: management_epg

port.description: The syslog service port of the remote destination. The range is from 1 to 65535.  The default is 514.

The severity of the event, alert, or issue that caused the syslog entry to be generated. The level can be:
  * emergencies
  * alerts
  * critical
  * errors
  * warnings: (default)
  * notifications
  * information
  * debugging
severity.title: severity

transport.description:
The transport protocol to use for the messages. The values can be:
  * ssl — If you select ssl as the transport protocol, the Cisco ACI switch (acting as a client) makes a secure, encrypted outbound connection to remote syslog servers (acting as a server) supporting secure connectivity for logging. With authentication and encryption, this feature allows for a secure communication over an insecure network.
  * tcp
  * udp: (default)
transport.title: transport

remote_destinations.title: remote_destinations

show_milliseconds_in_timestamp.description: Include msec in the log timestamp.  Default is false.

configuration_backups.description:
Required Attributes are:
  * name
  * remote_hosts

Additional Attributes are:
  * annotation
  * description
Import/Export > Export Policies > Configuration
  * format
  * include_secure_fields
  * max_snapshot_count
  * snapshot
  * start_now
Import/Export > Remote Locations
  * authentication_type
  * management_epg
  * protocol
  * remote_hosts
  * remote_path
  * remote_port
  * username
Schedulers > Fabric
  * delay_between_node_upgrades
  * maximum_concurrent_nodes
  * maximum_running_time
  * processing_break
  * processing_size_capacity
  * schedule
  * window_type
configuration_backups.title: configuration_backups - Admin => Import/Export - Configuration Backups with Export Policies, Remote Locations, and Schedulers

Admin:ImportExport.title: import_export - Admin => Import/Export - Configuration Backups with Export Policies, Remote Locations, and Schedulers

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

authentication_type.description:
Authentication Type Choice. Allowed values are:
  * usePassword: (default)
  * useSshKeyContents
authentication_type.title: authentication_type

delay_between_node_upgrades.description: Delay between node upgrades. Delay between node upgrades in seconds. Range: '0-18000'.  The default is 0.
delay_between_node_upgrades.title: delay_between_node_upgrades

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

format.description:
The data format to be used when exporting the configuration export policy. The format can be:
  * json: (default)
  * xml
format.title: format

include_secure_fields.description: This requires the Global AES Setting to be enabled for this to be set to true.  Default is false.
include_secure_fields.title: include_secure_fields

management_epg.description: The name of the Management EPG to assign to the server.  Default is 'default'.
management_epg.title: management_epg

max_snapshot_count.description: A value between 0-10.  The default is 0.
max_snapshot_count.title: max_snapshot_count

maximum_concurrent_nodes.description: The concurrency capacity limit. This is the maximum number of tasks that can be processed concurrently.  The default is 0.
maximum_concurrent_nodes.title: maximum_concurrent_nodes

maximum_running_time.description: The processing time capacity limit. This is the maximum duration of the window. The range is 0 to (2^64 - 1) milliseconds. The default value of 0 indicates unlimited, meaning there is no time limit enforced on the scheduler window.  The default is 0.
maximum_running_time.title: maximum_running_time

name.description: Name of your Configuration Backup Policy.
name.title: name

processing_break.description:
A period of time taken between processing of items within the concurrency cap. Allowed Min Value: '00:00:00:00.001'(Format is DD:HH:MM:SS.Milliseconds).
* NOTE: (If user sets '00:00:00:00.000' as a value, provider will accept it but it'll set it as 'none').
processing_break.title: processing_break

processing_size_capacity.description: Processing size capacity limitation specification. Indicates the limit of items to be processed within this window. Range: 1-65535.  The default is 0.
processing_size_capacity.title: processing_size_capacity

protocol.description:
Transfer protocol to be used for data export of object File Remote Path .  Allowed values are:
  * ftp
  * scp
  * sftp: (default)
Note: Value 'ftp' cannot be set if authentication_type is equal to 'useSshKeyContents'
protocol.title: protocol

remote_hosts.description: List of Remote Hosts to Export the Policy to.

items.description: The hostname or IP address for the export destination.

remote_hosts.title: remote_hosts

remote_port.description: Remote Protocol Port 0-65535.  The default is 22.
remote_port.title: remote_port

snapshot.description: Flag to set Snapshot for object configuration export policy.  Default is false.
snapshot.title: snapshot

start_now.description: Flag to start the export now.  Default is false.
start_now.title: start_now

schedule.description:
schedule - Attributes are:
  * days
  * hour
  * minute
Syslog settings for Console.

days.description:
Recurring Window Schedule Day(s). Options are:
  * - every-day: (default)
  * - even-day
  * - odd-day
  * - Sunday
  * - Monday
  * - Tuesday
  * - Wednesday
  * - Thursday
  * - Friday
  * - Saturday
  * - Sunday
days.title: days

hour.description: The hour that the recurring window begins.  The default is 23.
hour.title: hour

minute.description: The minute that the recurring window begins.  The default is 45.
minute.title: minute

schedule.title: schedule

username.description: Username for the Remote Host when authentication_type is set to 'usePassword'.
username.title: username

Admin:ImportExport:ConfigurationBackups.title: configuration_backups - Admin => Schedulers => Fabric: One-Time/Recuring Windows and Admin => Import/Export => [ Export Policies => Configuration | Remote Locations ].
